meanings.definition: To place or position something in a new location.
meanings.sent1: I will resite the flower pot to get more sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She decided to resite the picnic table under the shady tree.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to resite the toy mouse in a playful game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The migrating birds resite to warmer regions during the winter months.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologists carefully resite the ancient artifacts to a more secure museum display.

meanings.definition: To relocate or move to a different site.
meanings.sent1: We need to resite the campsite closer to the river for better fishing.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to resite their headquarters to a more central location.
meanings.sent3: The ants resite their colony after heavy rain flooded their previous home.
meanings.sent4: The nomadic tribe resite their tents frequently to follow the grazing animals.
meanings.sent5: The family had to resite their home due to the construction of a new highway.

meanings.definition: To cite or reference something again.
meanings.sent1: In the essay, the author will resite the important research findings.
meanings.sent2: The student was asked to resite the sources used in the project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reminded the class to resite their sources to avoid plagiarism.
meanings.sent4: The historian decided to resite the historical documents for further analysis.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to resite the experiment results to confirm the hypothesis.
